name: Durnan
description: The proprietor of the Yawning Portal, Durnan is a man of few words and a legendary retired adventurer. His grim demeanor and imposing presence command respect, and he runs his establishment with a quiet, no-nonsense authority.
ideals: Order: 'This is a respectable establishment. Keep your troubles out of it.'
Pragmatism: 'Everyone's welcome if they can pay. And behave.'
Quiet: 'Good drink is meant to be savored, not drowned out by chatter.'
bonds: The Yawning Portal, the cornerstone of his retirement.
The massive, two-handed sword hanging behind the bar.
The few old adventuring companions he still respects.
flaws: Has zero patience for foolishness or idle questions.
Comes across as deeply unfriendly, even when he isn't.
Assumes everyone is a lesser adventurer than he was.
motivations: To run a quiet, safe, and profitable tavern.
To ensure the dangers of Undermountain stay down where they belong.

canned_conversations.introduction: (He nods curtly as he wipes down the bar.) Ale or something stronger?
canned_conversations.ask_about_weather: I'll give you a free flagon of ale if you don't talk to me about the weather.
canned_conversations.ask_about_undermountain: It's a hole in the ground. You pay a gold dragon to go down. If you make it back, you can pay to be pulled up. Simple.
canned_conversations.ask_about_payment_to_exit_the_well: (Voice drops to a grim tone.) Everyone pays. No exceptions. (This is a nod to the infamous tale of him ordering a rope cut on a delver who couldn't pay the toll.)
canned_conversations.on_a_brawl_starting: You can use the front door. You can use the back door with the rest of the rubbish. But one way or another, you should leave.

linked_lore_by_name: The Founding of the Yawning Portal
